title-group.article-title: Rate of Convegence of a Stochastic Particle Method for the Kolmogorov Equation with Variable Coefficients

abstract.p: In a recent paper, E. G. Puckett proposed a stochastic particle method for the nonlinear diffusion-reaction PDE in [ 0, T] × R (the so-called "KPP" (Kolmogorov-Petrovskii-Piskunov) equation): \begin{equation*}\begin{cases}\frac{\partial u}{\partial t} = Au = \Delta u + f(u), \\ u(0, \cdot) = u_0(\cdot),\end{cases} \end{equation*} where 1 - u<sub>0</sub> is the cumulative function, supposed to be smooth enough, of a probability distribution, and f is a function describing the reaction. His justification of the method and his analysis of the error were based on a splitting of the operator A. He proved that, if h is the time discretization step and N the number of particles used in the algorithm, one can obtain an upper bound of the norm of the random error on u(T, x) in L<sup>1</sup>(Ω × R) of order 1/N<sup>1/4</sup>, provided h = O(1/N<sup>1/4</sup>), but conjectured, from numerical experiments, that it should be of order <tex-math>$\mathscr{O}(h) + \mathscr{O}(1 / \sqrt N)$</tex-math>, without any relation between h and N. We prove that conjecture. We also construct a similar stochastic particle method for more general nonlinear diffusion-reaction-convection PDEs \begin{equation*}\begin{cases}\frac {\partial u}{\partial t} = Lu + f(u), \\ u(0, \cdot) = u_0(\cdot), \end{cases}\end{equation*}, where L is a strongly elliptic second-order operator with smooth coefficients, and prove that the preceding rate of convergence still holds when the coefficients of L are constant, and in the other case is <tex-math>$\mathscr{O}(\sqrt h) + \mathscr{O} (1 / \sqrt N)$</tex-math>. The construction of the method and the analysis of the error are based on a stochastic representation formula of the exact solution u.
